p: The SHUE database includes information on a random sample of 246 global cities with populations over 15,000 obtained from GeoNames [ 9], stratified by national wealth in terms of Gross National Income (GNI) per capita (<US$1045, US$1045–4125, US$4125–12,746, >US$12,746) [ 10], population size (<100 K, 100 K–500 K, 500 K–1 M, 1 M–5 M, >5 M), and Bailey’s ecoregion ‘domain’ (dry, humid temperate, humid tropical, polar) [ 11]. The sample size of 246 was based on calculations of statistical power appropriate for comparative analyses of variables across cities in the database. A further 63 cities were added to this sample, primarily to include cities with specific characteristics and/or policies related to environmental sustainability. Here, we focus only on the 246 randomly-selected cities in the database ( Table 1).
